greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Product_{i in row n of A245562} Pell(i+1).
comment: This is the Run Length Transform of S(n) = Pell(n+1) (cf. A000129).

The Run Length Transform of a sequence {S(n), n>=0} is defined to be the sequence {T(n), n>=0} given by T(n) = Product_i S(i), where i runs through the lengths of runs of 1's in the binary expansion of n. E.g. 19 is 10011 in binary, which has two runs of 1's, of lengths 1 and 2. So T(19) = S(1)*S(2). T(0)=1 (the empty product).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..8191
maple: A000129 := proc(n) option remember; if n <=1 then n; else 2*A000129(n-1)+A000129(n-2); fi; end;
for n from 0 to 100 do lis:=[]; t1:=convert(n,base,2); L1:=nops(t1);
for i from 1 to L1 do
if out1 = 1 and t1[i] = 1 then out1:=0; c:=c+1;
elif out1 = 0 and t1[i] = 1 then c:=c+1;
elif out1 = 1 and t1[i] = 0 then c:=c;
elif out1 = 0 and t1[i] = 0 then lis:=[c,op(lis)]; out1:=1; c:=0;
if i = L1 and c>0 then lis:=[c,op(lis)]; fi;
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 10 2014; revised Sep 05 2014
